page.title: 16SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: Only a few teenagers admitted to both smoking and drinking but 50% did say they smoked. They all thought there were not enough youth clubs in the area. Non of those interviewed owned a car, motor bike or scooter. Of those married couples interviewed most thought they had a good standard of living and could cope well with there families. Mainly, they owned or were buying there own houses. None lived with relatives. They all had televisions and plenty of furniture. Most thought there houses were in good condition and none had woodworm or rising damp. Some thought they needed new window frames, doors and other repairs. Most over 60's drink alcohol but did not smoke, and most go to clubs. Most did not have disabilities.Two out of ten interviewed had jobs.
